q: Within technology circles, the move by Google Inc. -- born during the first dot-com boom-- to replace CEO Eric Schmidt with the 38-year-old Page left some wondering how the search giant would deal with middle age. Founder becoming CEO... Is this like a Steve Jobs returning or a Jerry Yang returning? Chris Dixon, a technology veteran who has invested in Skype and Foursquare, tweeted. Zahi Hawass said now that the Egyptian Museum's collection was secure from thieves, the greatest threat to the collection inside was posed by the torched ruling party headquarters building next door. What scares me is that if this building is destroyed, it will fall over the museum, Zahi Hawass said as he watched fire trucks spray water on the still smoldering NDP headquarters. A billion browser-based phones also means that Google can display advertisements to that many more people around the world. Already, even without achieving each of those developments, interesting services are available, Eric Schmidt said. We are at the point where, between the geolocation capability of the phone and the power of the phone's browser platform, it is possible to deliver personalized information about where you are, what you could do there right now, and so forth-- and to deliver such a service at scale, Eric Schmidt wrote. On Britain's Got Talent in 2009, Simon Cowell described their routine as one of the best things I have ever seen in my life . After their success in the TV talent show, Flawless have gone on to star in the movie StreetDance 3D, as well as appearing in music videos for Madonna, Beyonce, Leona Lewis and Westlife.
